If you set the 'source-tag-seeds' setting of your Frontier to 'true', 
each seed URI will be tagged with itself, and then each URI discovered 
from those seeds will inherit this same source seed. This source tag 
will appear in the second-to-last field of the crawl.log.

So, you'll be able to see from the crawl.log the seed from which any URI 
was discovered.

Note that it's not guaranteed to be the seed from which the shortest 
path to the URI can be found -- the crawler sometimes follows longer-hop 
paths more quickly than shorter-hop paths, and the source tag will be 
the seed from which the URi was actually discovered.

(The above is true for 1.14.1; it looks like a bug in 2.0.1 is 
preventing the source tag from appearing in the crawl.log.)

- Gordon @ IA
